line.en: 'We can't seem to find anyone.'
It's been two days since I joined the Soaring\nClub.
Since then, whenever we've had any spare time,\nAgeha has been trying really hard to recruit\nmembers.
Everyone was interested, yet not enough to join\nthe club.
'Hmmm... As I thought, everyone's scared of\nAmane.'
'She's not that scary, is she?'
'It's not that, she's just too incredible. Aoi,\nyou've only just transferred here, so maybe you\ndon't really know how it is.'
'That girl is like a living legend in our\nschool.'
I know firsthand that her weirdness is legendary.
'Also, there are rumors that she's antisocial.'

The basis for such rumors is not clear. But, she
doesn't have any friends, hardly shows up for
classes, and is locked away in the garage for the
entire day.
Even when she does come out, she's always alone\nand doesn't have any contact with anyone.
If you look at it like that, she certainly seems\nquite antisocial.
'The club is led by Amane, right? It looks like\npeople are worried that they won't be able to\nkeep up with her.'
'Then there's one other reason.'
'Oh, that rumor?'
There is something that I learned from looking\nfor members.
It is something said only in whispers, like some\nurban legend...
'If you get involved with the Soaring Club, you\nattract the attention of Tobioka-sensei.'
'Is that true?'
'Maybe. However, it's not impossible, is it?'
Tobioka Kujira-sensei.
His first name means 'whale', but he's not as big\nin size as you might imagine, but it's said his\nattitude is larger than life.
I've seen him before. He's the teacher acting as\nmoral advisor. He's the nagging and annoying\ntype.
There were a lot of teachers like that at my old\nschool. But here, it's a bit of a rarity.
'Tobioka-sensei is the advisor for the Robotics\nClub.'
In other words, the advisor to Ageha's club.
'I've told you before, right? Amane achieved\namazing things with the Robotics Club in the\npast.'
'She was one step away from the national\nchampionship, you mean?'
Ageha nods.
'And also that she pressed the wrong button on\nthe controller and lost?'
I know about Mochizuki-senpai to a certain\nextent. But, I didn't think she'd be the sort of\nperson to make such a simple mistake.
'There's more to that story.'
'Tobioka-sensei was the advisor to the Robotics\nClub at that time too, but when that happened, he\nwas so full of regret.'
'Yeah, most people would be.'
I would have felt the same way if I had been in\nthat situation.
'We'll get it next time!' He said to show his\ndetermination, it seems but...'
'A while after that, she suddenly quit the\nRobotics Club.'
'Why?'
'Well, I don't know. One explanation is that when\nAmane lost the national championship, she didn't\nseem that annoyed about it.'
'Since then, the Keifuu Robotics Club has been\nliving on the glory of the past. Now, they fail\nto achieve decent results.'
'So, you mean Tobioka-sensei blamed Amane for\nit?'
Ageha made a serious face and nodded.
'That's ridiculous.'
'...but I can't really say that.'
My last school was good when it came to sports.
There's a sports scholarship program, and it was\nimportant for the school to get results in\ntournaments.
The advisors and directors of each club are\nevaluated accordingly. At times, it may result in\na turning point in their lives.
The Robotics Club is the most popular club at\nthis school. Its performance is directly linked\nwith the promotion of the school.
Even if Tobioka-sensei blamed Amane, I can't\nexactly say that it's strange.
'Are you OK with this...?'
'What do you mean?'
'Well, Tobioka is your advisor, isn't he? Are you\nalright with him keeping an eye on you...?'
'Hmm, he might bug me with snide comments. But,\nif I use earplugs, I'll be fine.'
'That's not the problem, is it...?'
Ageha looked a little confused.
'I know what you're trying to say, Aoi. But\nthere's something more important at stake, so\nthere's not much I can do about it.'
'What do you mean, 'more important'?'
'Uh... well...'
'Oh, it's you two.'
'Aoi Minase and Ageha Himegi, wasn't it?'
'Hi.'
'Hello, vice president.'
'You must be in the middle of gathering new\nmembers? It doesn't look like things are going\ntoo well, does it?'
The vice president gave me a bitter smile as she\nmade her assumptions.
'Yes but it all comes down to us finding one more\nmember...'
'I will tell you this now but 'ghost members'\nwill absolutely not be accepted.'
she frankly stated.
'Hmmm... Why is that?'
'There must be other clubs that have ghost\nmembers, right?'
Why is it only us!?
The vice president glares at us as we make our\nchildish protests in vain.
'The other small scale culture-based clubs are\nbesides the point, the scale of the Soaring\nClub's facilities is just too big.'
'No other club occupies a garage like that.'
'The Robot Club uses a great big garage too,\ndoesn't it?'
'That has approximately 60 members. They have\nachieved results in national competitions.'
'...But the one who achieved those results was\nAmane.'
The vice president ignores Ageha's grumbling and\ncontinues to speak.
'If the Soaring Club were to vacate the garage,\nthe Light Music Club or the Taiko Drum Study\nSociety could modify it into a practice studio.'
'Also the R. C. Club, the Photography Club and\nthe Film Studies Group want to use it.'
'If a partition were to be added, then it could\nbe reused as a clubhouse for multiple clubs.'
'If you think about it like that, then there is\nno way that a club made by gathering ghost\nmembers will be accepted!'
'That's fair enough...'
Ageha and I felt small as we looked downwards. We\nbecame embarrassed about expressing our childish\nopinions.
'However...'
'She let out a little 'Whew...' as she sighed.
'If Mochizuki-senpai were to ask, there should be\nsome people who would join her.'
'In other words, you're not making any\nunreasonable demands...'
'Of course not. It's not my intention to get rid\nof the Soaring Club.'
'This sets a bad example to the other clubs, and\nI just want to straighten out the situation.'
'But, Amane isn't attempting to recruit members\nby herself.'
'It is really frustrating.'
'It looks like there's no other way but for me to\nplay the bad guy, and give Amane a big kick in\nthe butt!'
'I'm not saying you have to go that far.'
'Is that OK? For you to find proper club\nmembers?'
'Because ghost members will definitely not be\naccepted.'
the vice president reminded us as she walked\naway.
'...Akari is strict but a good person, isn't\nshe?'
'...Yeah. She doesn't seem very flexible though.'

She seems familiar with the student's names and
profiles, and it looks like she wouldn't be able
to get away with abusing the power that comes
with the position.
'But it's strange, isn't it?'
'What do you mean?'
'That although Amane suddenly left the Robotics\nClub, she's kept pace with the Soaring Club for\nyears.'
'Until she became the Super Repeat Student.'
'...Yeah, you've got a point there.'
'Even so, she isn't trying to get any new\nmembers.'
'I guess she really is antisocial after all.'
The more I know about the situation, the less I\nunderstand it.
After school, Ageha and I headed to the Soaring\nClub's garage.
After all, we're already members.
'Hey, I'm sorry guys.'
As she looks at us, Amane bows her head in\napology.
'Cut it out, Amane!'
'Yeah! Seeing you like this makes me feel like\nI'm taking years off my life.'
'If it's no good, I plan to leave here without\nfuss.'
'I'm still looking for a place I can transfer\nto.'
'Does that mean you're giving up on the club?'
Amane nods apologetically.
'...Amane, why don't you look for new members\nyourself?'
'I'm only doing this for myself, so I don't have\nany reason to involve other people.'
Is that what she really thinks?
'Is that because you don't want to let anyone to\ncome near this place? If so, then we...'
'No, that's not it! People are always welcome to\ncome and take a look!'
'But how about becoming members?'
'Oh... I don't know...'
'If they don't, then I know I won't be able to\nstay here.'
'...That would be a big problem.'
'But... As for what I should do, I still haven't\nbeen shown the answer.'
Amane really looked distressed, and became\ndespondent.
If we ask any more questions, all we'll be doing\nis cornering her even more.
'Anyway, once you've built the glider, what do\nyou plan to do next?'
'Enter a competition?'
We can use the club's objectives as material for\nour recruitment drive.
As far as the quick check that we did goes,\napparently there are competitions for gliders\ntoo...
'Competition? No, I'm not planning to enter\nanything like that.'
'Huh? So, what are you going to do?'
'...There's a place I want to go to.'
Amane gave a smile, it seemed just like she was\nabout to start reminiscing about old times.
'A place you want to go to?'
'That's what Isuka said. Once the glider is\ncomplete, we can go there.'
'Isuka...?'
She said that name before.
...It will fly to the sky that Isuka spoke of.
Looking as if memories had come flooding back,\nshe looked at the photo frame on the desk.
The photo frame without a photo.
She looked like she had gone into her own little\nworld, and it didn't seem that we could ask her\nany more questions.
'...Well then, we'll be off.'
'To search for people who might join the club.'
Whatever answer Amane gives, avoiding having the\nclub's status repealed was the top priority.
'...Oh, I'm sorry.'
'No, no. Instead of that, please try to do make\nsomething that can demonstrate the club's\nactivities.'
'OK, got it.'
It was past nine o'clock at night.
In the kitchen, I was washing the dishes for five\npeople.
In the dormitory, there were six people including\nmyself but...
Kotori didn't show up for dinner, or to help\nprepare beforehand. She was shut away in her\nroom.
Just in case, I put her dinner in the fridge. If\nshe gets hungry, she can eat it whenever she\nwants.
'Maybe she's feeling down...'
Why does she want to drop out of school?
Is it because of what Ageha said, that it was\nbecause of the arguments she had with the girls\nin the class?
Is it because the lessons are boring?
Or could it be something that I don't know about?
It's possible. It could even be something that\nnot even she understands.
'...I of all people can't really say anything\nabout other people.'
I don't think that anyone would understand the\nreal reason why I came back to this town.
To be honest, I still haven't really solved\nthings for myself yet...
As I began to feel kind of down, I was surprised\nto hear the sound of footsteps stomping down the\nhallway.
'Kanako...!!?'
'Aoi, do something!'
'W-What is it? Could it be that you were attacked\nby a pervert?'
While I had my back to her, I couldn't stop my\neyes from looking around in her direction.
'No, not that. It's Kotori!'
'Huh?'
Someone had taken Kotori's clothes off?... No,\nthat can't be it.
'She said she's having a bath by herself, and she\nwon't listen to us!'
'Oh. Why don't you let her take a bath...?'
'No way. She said she's going to get into the\nbathtub.'
'In the bathtub?'
The wheelchair was in the bath's dressing room.
It was the wheelchair that Kotori used when in\nthe bathroom.
She always used that when she took a shower.
...I've never seen her do that, of course.
She can't get into the bathtub while still in the\nwheelchair.
For her to get in the bathtub, she needed someone\nto help her.
'Her older sister isn't here, is she? She said\nshe couldn't wait any longer...'
According to what I'd heard, Kotori has an older\nsister.
She only gets into the bathtub when she comes\nhere.
Anyway, her sister hadn't come around here\nrecently.
At least, not since I'd become the dorm mother.
'No, leave me alone! I have a shower every day,\nso I felt like taking a bath!'
'That's why I asked you to just let me in.'
'No way, that's sexual harassment! Get lost!'
'That's why, I need you to do it, dorm mother.\nHelp her into the bath.'
'Whaaaat!?'
Kanako seemed to say 'I'm not coming with you' as\nshe left me by myself.
'Hey, wait!'
As she left me behind, I turn to face Kotori.
'...Alright, shall I help you get in?'
She was glaring at me with an angry look on her\nface.
'I can get in the bath by myself.'
'Yeah, but...'
'Hmph!'
'Hey, hold on!'
Kotori went into the dressing room and closed the\ndoor.
If she does that, I can't exactly go barging in\nthere all of a sudden.
'If you have any problems, call me right me away,\nOK?'
'I won't let you peek!'
she replied in a scary voice.
There's nothing else I can do, so I wait outside.
I sit down in front of the dressing room door,\njust like I'm guarding it.
This isn't really that important but to have one\nguy in a girl's dormitory makes taking a bath\nreally inconvenient.
I'm the only one who has a set time.
If I inadvertently run into any of them in here,\nI can't just get away with an apology.
From the bathroom, I could faintly hear the sound\nof the shower.
She must be washing herself off before getting\ninto the bath.
I can hear the sound of the water lightly\nsplashing.
'...I feel kind of nervous.'
The limited information I get from the sound\nactually stirs my imagination.
I am strongly aware of the fact that Kotori is\ngetting into the bath.
'...What am I thinking?'
If she knew what I was imagining, she'd probably\ntry to tear me apart, limb from limb. As I try to\nclear the thoughts from my head...
SPLASH!
I react by bolting upwards. I open the dressing\nroom door, and dash inside.
'Uhh-bwaaa...bwaaaa!!'
'Are you OK!!?'
I jumped into the bathtub, and lift Kotori out,\nwhile she wriggled and struggled with her hands\nout of the bath.
'Haa, haa, haa, haa, haaa...!'
'Hey, snap out of it! Kotori!'
Kotori was still panicking and clung desperately\nas I rescued her.
'You're OK now.'
'Haa, haa, haa...'
Kotori looked at me.
It looked like she didn't know who, or even what\nshe was clinging to.
'Haa, haa...'
'It's alright. Everything's fine now.'
'...Yeah.'
Kotori weakly nodded while still holding onto me\ntightly.
I continued to hold onto her, to calm her down...
Both of us suddenly realized what we had failed\nto realize before!
Kotori was stark naked, and I...
I was holding her in my arms.
'Eeeek!!'
'Ah, umm, I'm sorry!'
For a moment, we didn't say anything but she\ncouldn't exactly kick me out, so we just held\nonto each other.
Kotori tries to hide her chest, but squeezes even\ncloser towards me.
'It's... it's OK! I'm not looking!'
'Sniff... sniff...'
Kotori goes bright red and looks like she's about\nto cry.
'I'll go now! Sorry!'
I was about to put Kotori down on the floor.
I that that if I went to call for Kanako, that\neverything would be cleared up.
'Don't go...'
Squeeze...!
Weakly yet desperately, she held onto me.
'I'm embarrassed... but...'
'But... please...'
Kotori's hands were shaking slightly.
I remember that time, when we first met on\nWindmill Hill.
'OK.'
I nod, and it seems like her shaking has subsided\na little.
'...Thank you.'
We stayed like this for a while, and Kanako poked\nher head into the bathroom to take a look.
'A heard a big noise. ...What happened?'
'Well, this and that...'
So this is the result of ignoring Kanako's\nadvice.
But if we were to say something like that in\nfront of the tearful, shaking Kotori, I would\nfeel really bad for her.
It seemed that Kanako was implying the same\nthing.
'Could you get a bath towel?'
'Okey dokey!'
'Then, could you cover Kotori up...?'
'Okey dokey!'
While Kanako put the towel round her, Kotori\nquietly held onto me.
After that, Kotori calmly got into the bath with\nKanako.
Kanako also made sure not to meddle\nunnecessarily, and was very considerate towards\nKotori, to help her calm down.
While I was doing the dorm mother's jobs in the\nkitchen, Kotori had gotten out of the bath and\ncame to see me.
She looked pretty embarrassed.
'...Thanks for just now.'
'Well, I...ah... never mind.'
'I stopped myself from saying something like\n'That's another one of the dorm mother's jobs'.
The reason why I did that just now was not\nbecause I'm the dorm mother.
'You must have been shocked...'
'...That I can't get into the bath by myself.'
I didn't know how to answer, and Kotori left me\nbehind and went back to her room.
'Hello, sis...?'
'...No, it's nothing. I'm not crying!'
'Umm, it's about school, that thing we were\ntalking about before...'
'Yeah... yeah...'
'...I've made up my mind.'
